### Background

This Pull Request aims to improve the macOS TTS functionality by removing URLs from the text input before passing it to the TTS engine. The rationale is to improve the user experience when listening to the TTS output.

### Changes

The following changes were made:

1. Update the `_speech` function with an additional line of code to remove URLs from the input text using a regular expression.

```python
import re

#... macOS TTS code ...

def _speech(self, text: str, voice_index: int = 0) -> bool:
    text = re.sub(r'\b(?:https?://[-\w_.]+/?\w[-\w_.]*\.(?:[-\w_.]+/?\w[-\w_.]*\.)?[a-z]+(?:/[-\w_.%]+)*\b(?!\.))', '', text)
    #... remaining macOS TTS code ...
```

2. Imported the `re` library to handle regular expressions.

### Documentation

The new code removes URLs from the input text using a regular expression. The `re` library was imported to handle regex patterns, and the URLs are removed from the text using the `re.sub` function. The code has an appropriate in-line comment explaining the purpose of the change.

### Test Plan

1. Test various input text strings containing URLs and verify that the URLs are removed from the TTS output.
2. Test the functionality with multiple different voices to ensure compatibility.
